definition: to disappear/to vanish/to eliminate/to spend (time)/have to/need
thin/to lose weight/(of clothing) tight/(of meat) lean/(of land) unproductive

sentences.english: The prisoners were left to rot in prison.
sentences.chinese: 那些囚犯被留置在牢中任其消瘦。

sentences.english: He was emaciated by long illness.
Make it your mission to give yourself a purpose —other than pining for your ex.
sentences.chinese: 給自己個目標作爲任務，但不要是爲以前的情人消瘦。

sentences.english: The teacher was leaned out by his long illness.
sentences.chinese: 長年生病使這位老師變得消瘦。

sentences.english: You are emaciated and ill-looking , you are near to death!
sentences.chinese: 你消瘦羸弱，氣色不好，死亡已經臨近。

sentences.english: High leptin levels relay the opposite signal.
sentences.chinese: 高消瘦素水平傳遞相反的信號。

sentences.english: His body was wasted by long illness.
sentences.chinese: 他的身體由久病而消瘦了。

sentences.english: Square frames will also slim down your wide cheekbones and eye area.
sentences.chinese: 方形鏡框則會讓你較寬的顴骨和眼部看起來略顯消瘦。

sentences.english: By the time her rabbi came to visit her, she was emaciated.
sentences.chinese: 當她的拉比來看她時，她已經消瘦下去了。

sentences.english: Can these lean and unpuffy models really be pregnant?
sentences.chinese: 這些苗條消瘦的模特們真的能懷孕嗎？

sentences.english: However, five years later, gaunt and having lost a lot of weight, Jobs had a liver transplant.
sentences.chinese: 但5年之後，日漸消瘦的喬布斯被迫接受了肝移植。

sentences.english: The rich brocade still keeps taking that light narrative, the body delivers emaciatedly extra.
sentences.chinese: 錦繡仍然帶着那層輕紗，身子愈發的消瘦。

sentences.english: The old man suffered from serious stomach trouble and began to rot away.
sentences.chinese: 這位老人患有嚴重的胃病，並逐漸消瘦。

sentences.english: Zhangfang was quite thin when I last saw him, but he has broadened out a tot.
sentences.chinese: 上次我看見張方時，他非常消瘦，現在卻長胖了許多。

sentences.english: Marasmus can be confused with dehydration; very often children suffer both.
sentences.chinese: 消瘦型營養不良與脫水很難區分，兩者經常同時出現。

sentences.english: A long illness had emaciated the invalid.

definition: wan and sallow/thin and pallid/haggard/(of plants) withered
to be all skin and bones (idiom)/also written 皮包骨[pi2 bao1 gu3]
yellow face, emaciated body (idiom); malnourished and sickly in appearance
